intro: Ateramnus longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed ateramnus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible parts. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. Ateramnus longipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
